definition: on the eve of/to be about to/to be on the verge of
namely/that is/i.e./prompt/at once/at present/even if/prompted (by the occasion)/to approach/to come into contact/to assume (office)/to draw near
will/shall/to use/to take/to checkmate/just a short while ago/(introduces object of main verb, used in the same way as 把[ba3])

sentences.english: But for now, a symbolic moment is about to occur.
sentences.chinese: 但在眼下，一個象徵性的時刻即將出現。

sentences.english: In this age of the keyboard , some people seem to think handwriting lessons are on the way out.
sentences.chinese: 在這個鍵盤的年代，有人似乎認爲書法課即將滅亡。

sentences.english: It's my Daddy, the actor, about to die with his boots on.
sentences.chinese: 那是我爸爸，那個演員，即將橫死的畫面。

sentences.english: John's about to start a nine-week national speaking tour.
sentences.chinese: 約翰即將展開一場歷時九周的全國巡迴演講。

sentences.english: Perhaps Images from the forthcoming cold heart would re-warm.
sentences.chinese: 乜許那顆即將冰冷旳心會重新溫暖。

sentences.english: We're having a whip-round for old Fred , who's leaving the firm.
sentences.chinese: 我們正在爲即將從公司退休的老弗雷德進行募捐。

sentences.english: Gordon G. Chang is the author of The Coming Collapse of China.
sentences.chinese: 章家敦是《中國即將崩潰》一書的作者。

sentences.english: Bamboo fence that lines the dying rose, hurt people 's heart.
sentences.chinese: 竹籬笆旁那株即將凋謝的玫瑰，刺痛了路人的心。

sentences.english: About the plane from the ground, the McCarran ignited the gasoline floating down the runway.
sentences.chinese: 在飛機即將離地時，麥卡倫點燃了跑道上灑落的汽油。

sentences.english: Week -long national day is coming. I'm looking forword to seeing Yun who was my good classmate at college.
sentences.chinese: 十一長假即將來臨，萬分期待着大學同學贇的到來。

sentences.english: Group1: The thief was a girl who is going to marry but is too poor.
sentences.chinese: 小偷是一個即將結婚但又很窮的女孩。

sentences.english: The long-haired OA-Puss will celebrate her 24th birthday in January — much to the  astonishment of Quentin Shaw, who has owned her since 1987.
sentences.chinese: 這隻長毛貓貓，即將在一月份迎來自己的24歲生日。

sentences.english: So here's to the impending revolution in biology. Come Darwin's 300th anniversary there will be even more to celebrate.
sentences.chinese: 所以，我們預祝即將來臨的生物學革命。當達爾文誕生

sentences.english: In mid-month, Ken Starr announced he was stepping down.
sentences.chinese: 中旬，斯塔爾宣佈即將離任。

sentences.english: Her darling boy was to come back to her repentant and tender-hearted.
sentences.chinese: 她的寶貝孩子即將懷着悔罪和體貼的心回到她的身邊。

sentences.english: Hop rectify the name Park Phase I sold out , Phase 2 Jifang Park will be on sale.
sentences.chinese: 合正名園一期售罄後，二期吉芳園即將發售。

definition: auxiliary verb introducing future action: may (be able to)/will (cause)/should (enable)/going to
in turn/successively/one after the other/bit by bit
will/shall/to use/to take/to checkmate/just a short while ago/(introduces object of main verb, used in the same way as 把[ba3])
plan/project/program/to plan/to map out/CL:個|个[ge4],項|项[xiang4]
variant of 計劃|计划[ji4 hua4]
preparation/to prepare/to intend/to be about to/reserve (fund)
to unfold/to carry out/to be in full swing/to launch
